explanation: The original code called s.sort(), which sorted all N nicknames. The problem requires sorting only the top K participants (the first K input strings) and printing those in lexicographical order. I fixed the line to sort only the first K elements using slice assignment (s[:k] = sorted(s[:k])), so the subsequent loop printing s[0..k-1] outputs the correct sorted top-K nicknames.
fixed_code:
n, k = map(int, input().split())
s = [input() for _ in range(n)]
s[:k] = sorted(s[:k])
for i in range(k):
  print(s[i])
